inn1.comm: angled across on a length outside off, good carry through to the keeper as Ingram leaves
slightly back of a length, shaping down the leg side - that will be a wide
sliding across on a length outside off, steps out and leaves again
length in the corridor, gets forward and shoulders arms
big swing for Anderson, full and wide and hooping even further as Ingram chases it fruitlessly

straightens on him this time and rapped on the knee roll, gone! Anderson only needs two cards to trick Ingram, a huge outswinger followed up by a length ball that holds its line on middle and leg, the bat was late coming down to join the pad and up goes the finger. Ingram looks at Amla momentarily before sloping off without asking for a review
steams in, this veers down the leg side off a length
stays back in front of middle and leg and jabs down defensively to a length ball
floated up outside off, Amla waits on it and calmly steers a single to third man - there, there, Hashim's got it covered
on the pads, Peterson clips it wide of square leg to get of the mark too
back of a length, quick and bouncy and softly dabbed towards point off the back foot

tries to pull out and it clips the toe, brilliant catch by Buttler, they've got Amla too! Finn's extra pace probably key here, the ball shaping away on a good length outside off, Amla knew he didn't want to play at it but with his twirly backlift couldn't quite draw the bat out of the way, just a small deflection and it went low to Buttler's right where he snagged it securely. England are in clover!
short and around off stump, du Plessis shapes to try and pull but quickly drops his hands
line and length in the channel outside off, gets a stride in and shoulders arms
big booming inswinger, this is outrageous stuff from Anderson, the batsman gets willow nowhere near leather but it thumps the pad outside leg
shaping back at Peterson on a good length again, gets behind this to defend
speared across and whipping away towards first slip, no shot played - wisely
attacking the stumps again, Peterson is squared up as the ball curls back but he blocks solidly
in, out, shake it all about... this darts away off a length, takes a thick outside edge as Peterson pushes forward and runs low to third man
gets forward and shows a solid forward defensive around the line of off stump
too straight, stays back and flicks a length ball off the pads through square leg
pitched up and angled across, opens the face and guides the ball low to point
full and wide, in Peterson's slot and he unleashes a glorious cover drive, good connection and flowing follow through, beats the fielder's slide to the boundary
slightly full and swinging in on middle and off, Peterson shows it the face
dug in short and quick, flashes across the left-hander as Peterson pulls wildly, misses
seaming away off a length in the channel outside off, leaves this one
lovely shape on an outswinger in the channel, wide enough for du Plessis to leave though
full and tickled off the front foot into the leg side
strays down the leg side, even Anderson struggling a little to control the ball in these conditions
pushed across, slightly full and leaving Peterson, who's happy to leave
straighter, hops back and defended on the stumps
pitched up on leg stump and Peterson times a flick through midwicket very well, not quite enough to get four though
a peach of a ball, full and nibbling away as du Plessis plunged forward, he just manages to hold his bat inside the line
slanted across on a length, left outside off stump
short ball, at the body, Peterson is confident to rock back and pull into the ground through square leg, good enough connection to beat fine leg running round
sprays this down the leg side, low full toss and Peterson only needs a snick of bat on it to get four... and Finn has tumbled over in his follow through, too
four more, driven dreamily back down the ground! Too full and wide from the bowler, Peterson watches it under his nose and punches crisply past mid-off
better length and sailing through outside off, lets it go
leg-stump line, clipped behind square, slightly aerial but nowhere near a catcher
slightly short and left alone outside off stump
angled across and pushed into the covers coming forward
good length and on a testing line outside off stump, Peterson leaves
pitched up and dabbed on the front foot into the covers
ooh, little bit of luck for Robbie P, hanging back and dangling his bat out, takes the inside edge and just misses the stumps
fullish and tight on off, holding its line and well defended on the front foot
good length and angled across outside off, defended into the off side from the crease

dropped but it would have been a mind-blowing take from Ian Bell at extra cover! Peterson continues to attack, this is driven hard but uppishly and Bell dived two-handed to his left, the ball clanging away off the fingertips
gets forward and drives on the up again, this bobbles to mid-off
squared up and edged high over backward point, Peterson had no idea where that was going, trying to play across the line, but it lands safe
pinged through midwicket for four, du Plessis' first - lovely stroke, right off the middle coming forward to a full, straight delivery
length ball around the off stump, blocked into the off side
shapes back as Peterson comes forward and gets in a bit of a tangle attempting to block
angled across, full-pitched and flayed off the front foot but straight to that newly stationed close fielder
on the hips and flicked through square leg
full and shaping away, du Plessis goes across and then decides to leave it well alone
slightly shorter, straightening outside off again, hops back and shoulders arms - well judged
good length and angled in, holding its line, blocked on the front foot
slightly back of a length and coming back over the top of off, defended from the crease
angled across, short and heading towards first slip, Peterson goes across and dabs one into the leg side

cross-seam delivery from Broad - even in these conditions England are thinking about reverse, it seems - but it's a touch wide, du Plessis reaches out and clatters an angled drive through extra cover for four
outside off, short of a length, defended back to the bowler
length ball, outside off, du Plessis waits on it and then chops through backward point, well timed but Trott gallops round from third man to prevent another boundary
a touch fuller, punched on the front foot straight to mid-off
goes round the wicket, angled in and then holding its line to beat Peterson's dab
even better delivery, on that in-between length, curling away as Peterson presses forward and is beaten again
straighter, outside off and Peterson thrusts out his front pad as the ball sings through, gives Anderson a grin
draws him out again as the ball swings away, gets his bat inside

attacks the stumps this time, hit on the knee and given! Having repeatedly pulled Peterson across his wicket with the ball that leaves him, Anderson pitched this one full and straight - hit in front of middle, the only question was whether it would have gone on with angle past leg stump but Peterson decides against reviewing after a few words with du Plessis. England have pinched out the pinch-hitter
straight and a touch short, over the top of leg stump and de Villiers wears it on the pad
short and around the line of off, defended back down the track
pitched up and asking to be driven, du Plessis obliges and picks up three into the deep through cover
in the channel, length delivery, de Villiers tucks his bat out of the way
fuller, outside off, punched off the front foot to mid-off
good length, shaping away in the channel outside off, de Villiers leaves
bit of a neither nor leave from ABdV, hopping back outside off and playing inside the line as the ball zips through off a length
gets forward to defend a good-length ball around off
very full, going for the yorker, du Plessis jams his bat down on it and the ball loops up and drops a few inches wide of his off stump - not sure he spotted where it had gone
brings the bat down at an angle and gets a thick edge to third man
de Villiers gets forward to block a good-length delivery around the line of off
length on off, gets across to cover the line
dug in a touch short, over middle and leg, stays back and blocks to midwicket
gets across to defend a length ball
short of drivable length, stands tall and drives to mid-on
tip and run to mid-off, there's a shy at the non-striker's end but du Plessis was home

full and wide, de Villiers plays a filthy swat and nicks off! Broad is charging around with his finger in the air - they check for the no-ball but it's about a mile behind the line, compared to the Williamson dismissal the other day. It was another cross-seam delivery, not sure what de Villiers was thinking, he flung a horizontal bat out and the under-edge was audible. He drags himself away, leaving his side in real trouble

hit in front first ball, playing down the wrong line and given by Rod Tucker! Duminy looks crestfallen but eventually asks for the review, it struck him on the knee roll in front of middle but crucially pitched just outside leg stump, do the decision is overturned
angled across on a good length and left along, dropping the hands out of the way
tossed up around off, flicked through midwicket, slightly aerial but they get one
Duminy is hit in front again! Tredwell drifted this one on with the arm from round the wicket and he was hit directly in front of leg... but England decide not to review the not-out decision
slightly wider, straightening around off, plays this very late
tossed up around off and poked into the off side to get Duminy off a blob
floated up, spinning in and defended
tossed up outside off, du Plessis gets forward and covers the line
short and tapped square on the off side from the crease
on the stumps, straightening and clipped off leg stump through square
gets forward to a length ball around off and defends
slides down the leg side, is this a thin edge? Buttler didn't get there anyway and leg byes are given
pitched up and boomed down the ground, a lofted on-drive from du Plessis, into the gap and away for four to long-on
gets forward crabbily and defends a length ball into the off side
goes back and punches the ball back to the bowler
tossed up from round the wicket, driven on the front foot, Tredwell dives to makes the stop
drops a little short and knocked through the covers
tossed up outside off, du Plessis makes an early movement forward and paddles to leg, just past Buttler, who has anticipated the shot

played on, Tredwell gets Duminy after all! There wasn't room for the cut, it was an offbreak that skidded on and cramped him for room, Duminy hasn't looked comfortable against spin and he cannons a bottom edge on to the stumps
continues round the wicket, tossed up and Miller defends studiously on the front foot
straight and flicked off the pads for a couple through midwicket
full and in the channel, driven back and Finn stops it
full again and sweetly timed on the drive, deserved more than a single but it's well cut off by a diving mid-off
slightly short, tapped into the covers off the back foot
length ball on the stumps, clipped through backward square
a fierce lifter in the channel, speared across from over the wicket, Miller raises his hands in the air
over the wicket, tossed up and worked with the spin through midwicket
pushed through on off stump, defended on the front foot
flat and on the stumps, whipped through midwicket with a strong bottom hand, three players give chase and they just about prevent a boundary

quicker ball, flashes hard and scrapes the edge and Buttler takes it! South Africa are six down! Du Plessis moved across outside off, Tredwell seemed to dart it through a little wider in response, the bat came through late and the set du Plessis falls
round the wicket, angled in and skidding through, only a few inches wide of off as McLaren elects to shoulder arms to his first delivery
gets foward and defends a fullish ball back to the bowler
four for Miller, he times a punch square off the back foot, getting on top of the bounce and using the pace, Morgan gets a hand on it at point but can't pull it in
beaten, a tigerish response from Finn, back of a length and keeping Miller in his crease as he fished outside off
low full toss this time but it almost results in another dismissal, as Miller bunts the ball just short of extra cover
length ball in the channel, gets forward to drive on the up to the sweeper at deep cover
good length and this jumps at McLaren, who fends it away, an edge falling short of the gully
stays in the crease and defends towards point
full ball on off stump, tapped back to the bowler

down the wicket, comes off the pad to slip, appeal for lbw but McLaren is out of his ground and Trott is very aware of that and runs him out with a little underarm throw. Superb work. McLaren skipped down the wicket, got beaten trying to play to leg and then couldn't get back into his ground quick enough as Trott hit the stumps directly
forward and pressed into the covers
forward again and pressed to silly point
forward again just outside off, angled in front of point and they take a quick single
full on the off stump, ran out through the covers for an easy single
full length sliding just outside off stump and left alone
a little fuller and driven firmly to mid-off
plays at this as it runs away past his outside edge, well bowled Finn, decent lick
plays again outside off stump, able to drive at this and gets it to mid-off's right who dives and saves
pushes at it outside off and gets beaten once more, great line from Finn, just back of a length this time
much shorter, outside off, tries to upper-cut but misses
tossed up outside off, Morris forward and opens the face backward of square and gets a couple as Broad goes back from short third man
tighter off stump line and blocked back up the wicket

slider outside off, played forward and nicked behind, another one falls and it's Tredwell again, floating one up nicely just outside off, Morris came forward again but the delivery slid on and feathered his outside edge on the way through to Buttler
forward with an awkward jab, gets it to point
a little fuller, driven to short extra-cover
this turns a little and beats the inside edge, comes off the pad as Kleinveldt plays forward and runs into the off side
down the track and smashed over long off, super strike and all the way for six, big stroke
punched hard from the crease to backward point
flicked at outside off stump, good length that, played and missed, two backward points are in place
tighter line and worked down to long leg
back and across the off stump to block up the wicket
fuller length but played back again, kept out up the wicket
middle and leg line, clipped past square leg, deep midwicket comes around to save the second
off stump line, played forward and knocked back up the wicket
forward, turn into the front pad, batsman got outside the line for the lbw shout
down the track and lifted over mid-off, a nice controlled easy stroke, very well played
now a flashing driven through backward point, a couple more, just a little width outside off
back and punches hard to short extra-cover
back of a length, pulled nicely and gets it through midwicket, well timed
played from middle and off towards midwicket, gap in the ring so they get a single
stays back and keeps out a pretty full ball up the wicket

back on his stumps again, struck on the pad, cry for lbw turned down, sliding down and too high for me but Cook reviews as a last minute decision, might as well I suppose but this is almost certainly down leg side. it's actually taking a good chuck of the leg stump, it wasn't too high, but the decision stays on the field
leg side wide, sarcastic cheers for the 100 up
clears the front leg and heaves out to deep square leg, struck pretty well but straight to the fielder
slower ball outside off stump, 75mph, cut off a bottom edge through cover
full and well wide of off stump, driven at hard and gets a thick inside edge through midwicket
straight line, blocked around middle and off in the crease
length ball just outside off, dabbed wide of third man for a couple
length again on off stump, blocked going back and across again, bring him forward Jim says Buttler
this is much fuller but the batsman stays in his crease and tucks to midwicket
middle and off length ball, kept out on the crease and worked back up to the bowler
leg side wide
middle and leg line, tucked in front of square leg for a quick single
just outside off stump on a length, dabbed down to third man
strays onto Miller's pads again, clipped down to long leg
just back of a length heaved over midwicket, doesn't get all of it and it's down towards the longest boundary so doesn't carry to the rope, decent strike though
step down the track and uppercut over point for six, another superb strike from Miller, first Finn over long off and now this, got it up and over the rope very well
another leg side wide is it, no off the pad says the umpire
forward and pushed from off stump back up the wicket
touch short, a little turn cuts off the attempted cut stroke, ends up dabbing it to cover
flatter, quicker ball, kept out on the crease around off stump
forward, a little inside edge onto the front pad
forward again, flicked back to the bowler from middle and off
just loses his line, goes to swing it away down the leg side, runs off the pad to fine leg, deep--backward square runs around to field
back of a length just outside off stump, punched hard to deep cover
off stump, stays leg side of it and guides to backward point
middle and off line, blocked up the wicket standing tall in the crease
full ball, blocked into the covers from off stump, gets it into the gap and they take a single
cut hard from back of a length just outside off, Morgan's dive at point misses and they get a single out to the sweeper
decent yorker but Kleinveldt manages to work it down to long leg, well bowled and well played
full ball pushed back to the bowler
flighted a little more, blocked back to the bowler again
a touch wider and flicked over cover, decent little stroke, a couple out to the extra cover boundary
slog swept into the stands over midwicket, a thumping stroke from off stump, really well struck
driven out through cover
forward and pressed back up the wicket from middle and off
forward and blocked from middle and off, gets a thick edge to square leg
fuller ball, pushed to short extra cover
driven firmly from just outside off to short extra cover again
slower ball on off stump, clubbed over the bowler's head, another meaty strike
length ball, blocked from off stump to cover
angled in and blocked to midwicket coming half-forward
off stump, a firm punch down to long off
forward and pushed from off stump towards cover
straighter line, blocked back up the wicket
flatter ball on off stump, driven to short extra cover
a touch fuller just outside off and slapped down to long off
middle and leg, pushed firmly up the wicket
length just outside off, slapped to extra cover, a good diving save
flicked in the air down the ground, long on is back but just can't get in to take the catch and does well to save four in the end
around the wicket, length on the stumps, blocked back to Bopara
off stump, played forward to extra cover
just a little wider of off stump and ran out through the covers to the sweeper
skidding full delivery around middle and off, blocked up the wicket
forward just outside off, blocked out through the covers
forward and flicked to short extra cover
flat ball on the stumps and smashed down the ground, straight enough to evade long on, fine strike again
middle and leg, clipped through midwicket
slog swept over midwicket, another decent strike and gets it away through wide long on
forward and presses through cover point
off stump, pressed to extra cover
played in a firmer fashion to the same fielder who fumbles so they take a single
pulled hard and gets it past midwicket, not a perfectly clean strike but it's away for four more
taken from just outside off, a late chop to short third man
slower ball, flicked off the stumps wide of short long leg and they get another couple
full ball on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
full ball on the leg side, clipped down to long leg, just fine of the fielder and they get a couple
full ball on the stumps, swung hard at, comes off low on the bat and just evades a diving midwicket, fortune favours the brave
full just outside off stump, driven hard and carved out to the sweeper, 50 for Miller, a face-saving innings at the moment, could be more
back of a length just outside off, Kleinveldt manages to get inside it
played away from the body from just outside off, ran down to third man
full on leg stump, clipped through square leg
forward and ran out through the covers from just outside off stump
stays in the crease and drops this towards point from off stump
length ball just outside off, driven at hard and plays and misses
too straight and this is clipped past short long leg, the outfield is quick and this is four
length ball on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
length just outside off, punched at and gets it to extra cover
back of a length down leg side
shorter, Kleinveldt backs away, Broad follow him and gets hit on the shoulder trying to hook
low full toss, swung back towards the bowler, Broad half-saves on the bounce

back of a length, a touch down the leg side, Buttler takes off and takes a fine catch and England end a very annoying stand that might have brought South Africa back into the game. It was banged in again by Broad, Kleinveldt couldn't get inside the line and gloved it to give Buttler the chance to take a fine catch

another bumper, ducked but also a touch on this and given out caught behind and Broad has wrapped things up nicely in two balls, couldn't duck under the short ball and Buttler takes his sixth catch of the innings, another little glove through to the keeper

inn2.comm: back of a length and down the leg side - one down, 175 to go
pushed across wide of the wicket, shaping away, Cook leaves
leg-stump line, Cook stays back and prods a length ball to mid-on
pitched up around middle and off and punched back to the bowler - Morris then has an exuberant shy at the stumps and misses, Cook well in his ground anyway
this one definitely swings away, wide and going further towards first slip as Cook shoulders arms
another awayswinger, this time outside the tramlines
slightly shorter, angled across Cook's bows from over the wicket, left
tighter line, beginning to come back on a length, hops back and shoulders arms
floated up on leg stump, Bell pushes forward and gets an inside edge, just wide of the man stationed at leg slip, it runs away for a couple - very nearly another immediate breakthrough
full and on the pads again, closes the face and taps square
Cook nudges off his pads and there's a moment's hesitation before Bell eventually slithers on his front across the line as the throw comes into de Villiers
tossed up and defended on the front foot
stays back and defends, comes off the shoulder of the bat and rolls short of slip
goes across his stumps and defends a length ball straightening on off stump
flat and slightly short outside off, cut off the back foot through point to the sweeper
on the pads, clipped through square from the crease
over the wicket to the left-hander, tossed up around off and defended on the front foot
Cook skips out and lofts the ball over midwicket, slightly ungainly and doesn't completely get hold of it but clears the ring
on the pads, worked through a gap in the leg side
stays over the wicket, pushed through on middle and leg, goes back and clips through square
tossed up and punched down the ground
straightening on leg stump, Cook brings the bat down the chops defensively square
tossed up full on leg stump and Cook sweeps confidently through backward square
gets forward to defend around off
this seems to skid on, a little straighter, "oohs" from the bowler as Bell blocks
tossed up nice and high, leans forward and defends
short and wide of the stumps, Cook's attempted cut takes a bottom edge into the ground and doesn't make it off the square
fuller, still a touch wide, Cook fiddles away from his body and misses
good pace from Morris, this is tight on off, coming back a little as Cook blocks
angled across and squaring the batsman up, he prods the ball away low towards point
good line, maybe stays a touch low, tapped back defensively around off
fullish, pitching on leg stump and blocked back to the bowler from in front of middle - good, tight maiden from Morris
over the wicket, pushed across short of a length, Bell defends from the crease
short and too much width, Bell drives off the back foot with an angled bat in front of square for England's first boundary
better line, pitching around middle and off and leaving Bell, who shoulders arms
sits in the crease and taps a length ball towards cover
beaten, length ball speared across, Tsotsobe scrambled the seam and the ball nibbled away as Bell swished loosely
he connects with this one, though, width again and Bell chops the ball out of the middle of the bat for another boundary through point
goes back and across and defends a shortish ball

short but not quite short enough to pull, Cook gets tucked up and feathers a bottom edge through to the keeper - Morris strikes! Good pace from Morris, that last over to Cook was very tight and he seemed to want to force the pace, ended up playing a crooked swipe and nicking off
full and straight, looking for an early lbw, but Trott loves it there and flicks the ball firmly behind square for a first-ball boundary
full, around the line of off, this time defended coming forward
dug in short, aiming for the top of Trott's block, he jerks his bat across the line, the ball dropping a few metres away from square leg, much to Morris' excitement
length ball, over the top of off, short-arm jab towards midwicket
floated up, drifting towards leg, pushes at it and the ball rolls in front of leg slip off the pad
tossed up and defended coming forward
flat and clipped off the pads, hopping back in the crease, they push hard for a second
full and flighted, big stride out and blocked back down the track
floaty delivery around off, punched back past the bowler
angled in towards middle and leg, Trott tucks another single off the pads
full and in Trott's smash it zone (seriously), thumped off the front pad for another boundary through midwicket
slightly back of a length and wide of the stumps, Trott's confident enough to tennis-racquet the ball flat through point, though a sterling boundary dive prevents four
another snorter from Morris, tight around off, Bell plays inside the line - just
pitched up and tapped off the legs, between midwicket and mid-on and they scamper one
gets forward to a slower ball in the channel and blocks

now this was close... Trott pushes towards mid-on and again wants a sneaky one, du Plessis is alert, bears down on the ball from midwicket and underarms at the stumps, a direct hit would have sent him back
excitement around the bat as Trott presses forward, there's a little daylight between bat and pad ... but possibly just a little wood on the ball before it thumped the front leg
gets forward and defends a full-length ball back down the pitch
rocks back and chops a delivery into the off side, straight to point
leading edge but it drops short of mid-off, Trott playing across the line to one that straightens, nervy moments
tossed up, turns a length ball straight to midwicket
flighted, gets forward to block on the front foot
pitched up around the line of off, blocked coming forward
stays back and flicks a short ball through backward square, it's wide of the fielder and they get back for a second
in the channel outside off, gets forward and watches it by
pitched up outside the line and punched to mid-off
length ball, defended into the cover region

touch shorter, in the channel, Bell gets a flick on it, another catch at the wicket! Familiar story Bell, who gets in and the out, not a delivery that did a great deal, though Kleinveldt hits the deck hard and it got up off a length, Bell opened the face and glided it straight to the keeper
beats the bat, turn for Peterson! Trott pushed forwards to a length ball that gripped and left him
gives this some air outside off stump, leans out and defends this one
tapped back on the off side
straighter line, this scuttles on and Trott only just gets his bat down in time, an inside edge saving him
floated up and punched into the ground straight to the close fielder on the off side
full and outside off, this isn't quite a half-volley but Trott gets his head over the ball and crumps it fine of mid-on for a boundary
Root hopes back and leaves a short-of-a-length ball outside off
in the channel, gets across his stumps and defends into the off side
again short of a length outside off, stays back and dabs one through backward point
half-forward in defence, gets an inside edge through his legs
pitched up on off stump, Trott moves across, closes the bat face and whips the ball down to fine leg
Root hops back and blocks a short ball square on the off side
back of a length, goes across and defends on the off side
pulled in the air but wide of mid-on, this seemed to stop on Trott and wasn't at all timed but fell safe
maintains a tight line around off, Root blocks on the back foot
fuller length and in the channel, stays low and punches a square drive into the off side, straight to point
pitched up and dabbed into a gap in the covers for another single
good pace and carry as a length ball flies through to de Villiers outside off, Trott uninterested
short and slightly wide, Root stays upright and cuts, can't get it through the infield
goes wide on the crease and angles the ball in, back of a length and Root gets on top of it to drive sweetly between point and cover, he plays that shot so well but it won't quite go all the way
length ball on the stumps, flicked straight to midwicket
goes well across outside off and tries to work a full ball to leg
length, in the channel outside off, left alone
straighter, short enough to pull and Trott rolls the wrists to steer it through square leg, Tsotsobe stops it but they get two
gets across and blocks a length ball into the off side
this is called wide but Root wasn't far off toeing it through to de Villiers - nearly knocked himself off his feet trying to cut that, did the wee lad
stays in the crease, covers the stumps in defence
rocks back and pulls a short ball, it goes to midwicket's right, there's a cacophony of "Yes", "No", "Yes" before Root sensibly ambles back to his ground before the throw comes in
dug in short, stays back and taps towards cover
full and slightly wide, gets forward and driven into the covers
short and at the man, nudged through backward square leg and they pick up a couple
floated up full and wide, buffet bowling and Trott helps himself, clattering a front-foot four through the covers
better line, in the channel, Trott goes back to going what he does best
touch short, angled across on a tight line around off stump, left alone
Trott gets outside off stumps and nudges a length ball to midwicket
touch short, dabbed away square on the off side
full length, Trott drops a bat on it and blocks towards cover
length ball over the top of off, plays back and steers a single behind square on the leg side
Trott makes a little premeditated shuffle down the track and McLaren drops short, nearly surprises the batsman, who pulls from in front of his nose
banged in short, wide enough for Root to free the arms, picking out backward point on the cut
drifting in off a good length, Root flicks off his pads, maybe just a tickle off material and it skids to the rope, even as McLaren was thinking about appealing for lbw
goes back and punches towards mid-on
slightly back of a length and wide of the stumps, tapped defensively square
full and in the channel outside off, Trott hops back and leaves at the last minute
pitched up outside off and deadbatted in defence
shortens his length, Trott waits and angles the bat to steer a single down to third man
woof, fetch that! Short and wide from Tsotsobe, jumps back and thrashes the ball away in front of point for four
from woof to ooph, as Root takes a glancing blow to the box, a length ball exploding through the surface and rearing up, taking the inside edge and deflecting on to groinal area and then off the pad
length ball, covers the line and defends this time
tries the bouncer, Trott's not interested, ducks
waits and dabs a short ball down to third man
angled in, full and pitching on middle, hangs back and clipped to leg
threads another boundary through the off side, short and wide from McLaren and forcefully cut off the back foot past backward point... England's target is below 100
on a length, worked to midwicket from off stump
pitched up on middle and off, waits and flicks to leg again
touch short and around the line of off, Trott shows it the full face in defence
steps across outside off stump and leaves a length ball tailing back in
slightly overpitched outside off and crumped into the ground towards extra cover, David Miller takes off and stops it one-handed
length ball, nudged into the leg side
short and outside off, Trott hops across his stumps and pulls flat through square leg
gets on top of a length delivery and pats back on the leg side
floated up on the stumps and tapped defensively to leg
pushed through a bit quicker, whipped through square leg from in front of the wicket
full and flighted, punched to mid-on
drops short and Trott dismissively cracks a pull short through square, there's a man sweeping out there but he won't cut it off
tossed up outside off stump, leans out and defends
strays down the leg side and helped on its way for a few more
oh glorious, overpitched and superbly driven through extra cover with the timing of Michael Vaughan, gorgeous
back of a length just outside off, cut and a good diving save at cover prevents another boundary
waits for this to come on and dabs down to third man
short ball outside off, Root gets right up to it and cuts to cover without timing it properly
waits for this to come on, it tails in and Root dabs square on the off side

driven at lazily, it gets an inside edge but de Villiers can't take it with the left hand, he was diving out and down to his left side but could only get a fingertip to it, not enough to save it running for four either, more importantly, Root didn't get his foot forward to it to drive properly
turned around the corner against the spin, a leg slip is in place, dives down with his right hand and misses what was, again, an exceptionally difficult chance
played on leg stump, gets a thick outside edge that runs past leg slip again and out towards deep-backward square
forward on middle and off, pushing into the off side
again driving lazy is Root, tries to stay leg side of this and gets a bottom edge and very nearly drags on
better footwork, back and pushed firmly to cover
forward this time, a good stride out and driven with good timing and almost gets it wide of mid-off, well saved by the fielder
length just outside off stump, left alone
much fuller and Root drives this and pushes just wide of mid-off
drags the length back but gives Root width to cut and he gets it off a bottom edge down towards third man
goes to pull but it skids on a little and Trott is hurried and hit in the midriff to a straight ball
leg side wide
a little shorter than two balls ago, Trott goes to pull and gets a glove on it fine on the leg side, Petersen runs around and saves very well in front of the pavilion
Root defends in the crease but was hurried in blocking around middle stump
forward just outside off, it spins away and beats Trott, bit of grip in the surface now
skids on as Trott looks to play to leg, struck on the pad, going down leg? Big cry for lbw, not out given and they don't review
floated up outside off, carefully driven through point, had to wait for that to come on
covered up around the off stump, pushed back to the bowler
glorious shot, that is as good as anything you will see, waited for and driven with expert timing opening the face a little to thread it through the gap between short extra-cover and orthodox cover
on side this time, flicking a full ball past the dive of midwicket, they run hard and come back for three
length ball, flicked out to deep midwicket for a single
back and cut hard to cover
full toss on off stump, clipped to midwicket
off stump, driven with a flick to mid-off
clipped with the turn to square leg
off stump, clipped to mid-on, hurried him a little
waits for it to come on and dabs down to third man
full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
too short, Root right up on top of the bounce and pulls past midwicket, really nicely timed
back on the off stump and dabbed into the covers
full and pressed firmly forward to mid-off
lets this come on and dabs it down to third man, comfortably played
Overpitched and too wide, Root waltzes forward and times it perfectly past extra cover, timing was glorious
stays back and gets beaten by a slider outsider off, bit of a nothing stroke
clipped to midwicket, no is the cry as the fielder dives and saves well
back and across the off stump, pushed back to the bowler
full on off stump, flicked powerfully past mid-on and the fielder does really well to parry it and save probably four, deep midwicket cleans up
forward just outside off, runs it behind point for a quick single
back on the stumps and pushed firmly to point
length ball just outside off left alone
full outside off, Root drives at it and misses, it was very full
back of a length, clipped through midwicket with a firm push from a straight line
back of a length, rides the bounce and steers it fine of third man so they get two
short and leg side, helped down to fine leg, useless delivery that, especially to a bloke on 60 not out
back of a length on off stump, pressed into the covers
back foot press to extra cover from extra cover
played again back and across the off stump, finds mid-off
another press off the back foot, this time to orthodox cover, didn't really time it
fuller length but the line drifts into the pads and Root clips down to long leg
forward and driving, that was nicely timed, find mid-off
back to late cute, the length was too full, misses
down the wicket and thumped down the ground past mid-on, controlled stroke, very well struck
stays back this time and pushed to point from just outside off
short, that is dirt, pummelled to deep midwicket
full on leg stump, flicked through midwicket and they get two as long on who's gone back runs around to his right

goes to paddle sweep, misses and loses his leg stump beaten by a little turn and it came off the thigh pad into leg stump. An unnecessary dismissal but a fine hand from Root. He just got a bit too far outside off stump and by the time the ball turned inside him Root was leaning across for it and the paddle sweep missed
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man for just a single
length ball wide of off stump, left alone
a little wider outside off and ignored again
forward just outside off stump, played into the covers
forward, pushed firmly from off stump back to the bowler
full and well wide of off stump, left well alone
back and clipped out to long on
played from leg stump to square leg
on the stumps and blocked back up the wicket
drags it down a little and whipped out through midwicket
back and clipped from just outside off out to deep midwicket again
stays leg side of a ball just outside off and slaps hard to cover point
forward just outside off stump and pressed to extra cover
leg stump, clipped to midwicket coming forward
full ball just outside off stump, pushed firmly to mid-off
forward and threaded past extra cover with magnificent timing, again so glorious from Trott, the union flags are unfurled in the stands
four more, this time flicked past mid-on, overpitched on off stump and Trott tucks it away again
back of a length sliding across the off stump, chopped on the bounce to point
dangerous, reverse swept from middle stump behind square on the off side, backward point goes back to field
firmly pushed from just outside off to mid-on, they take on the fielder and get home comfortably
back and flicked from off stump past midwicket, again the timing is very good indeed, almost gets it to the wide long on fence
forward and ran off the outside half of the bat behind point for a single
good length, played with the turn towards square leg, threatened to sweep to start with
back and cut pleasantly past point, it runs away quickly and they get three
played from just outside off to point on the back foot
tighter line, blocked on off stump into the covers
back of a length, blocked just outside off stump, playing a little away from the body
back and across the off stump to block
too much width, Morgan does he get-low-and-thrash-it-square thing and powers it through point, very well timed
full toss outside off, guided through the covers, whoops
bend of the front knee and blocked back to the bowler
back and pushed from just outside off stump to cover
floated up outside off and driven past extra cover, Trott finishes it in style
